sn4.12:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn4.12:1.2: Now, at that time the Buddha was teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
sn4.12:2.2: “The ascetic Gotama is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly.
sn4.12:2.3: Why don’t I go and pull the wool over their eyes?”
sn4.12:2.4: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha and addressed him in verse:
sn4.12:3.1: “Why now do you roar like a lion?
sn4.12:3.2: You’re so self-assured in the assembly!
sn4.12:3.3: For there is someone who’ll wrestle with you,
sn4.12:3.4: so why do you imagine you’re the victor?”
sn4.12:4.3: The Realized One, attained to power,
sn4.12:4.4: has crossed over clinging to the world.”
sn4.12:5.1: Then Māra the Wicked, thinking, “The Buddha knows me! The Holy One knows me!” miserable and sad, vanished right there.
